title: Tesco is selling salted caramel and hot chocolate flavour Baileys cakes
text:
Get the biggest money stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Now October is here, it seems like all the winter food is also arriving en masse, as Baileys has just announced its launching a new hot chocolate flavour version of its famous Freakshake cake, as well as Baileys salted caramel cupcakes.

Originally released last year, Baileys' boozy freakshake cake has now been brought back for a second time around - and this time, with a chocolately twist.

Serving 16 people in total, you can buy the new hot chocolate flavour freakshake cake both in store and online on the Tesco website for £13.

Asda also sell it for the same £13 price tag, whilst Sainsbury's have it for £1 cheaper, at £12 a pop.

As for the Baileys salted caramel cupcakes, you get nine mini cakes in one pack, which will cost you just £4 , although you'll only be able to get them from Tesco right now.

Apparently, you'll need to show ID when you buy them due to their alcohol content, although we can't see any indication of how much ABV there is per cake.

News of the new boozy cakes follows the launch of salted caramel Baileys last week, which is set to be sold in Asda first from the 10th October, before Morrisons and Sainsbury's follow next month.

Originally spotted by Facebook page Money Saver Online, the cakes have already racked up a lot of excited comments from hungry shoppers, with one user saying "I need this in my life”, while another commented: “Can I have this for my birthday please, anyone?”.
description: Two new cakes have launched at Tesco - both containing Baileys - including salted caramel Baileys cupcakes and hot chocolate Baileys freakshake cake
